author: KT1600

review: I really wanted to love Chromecast because of the price and the supposed functionality that Google promised with it, but it just fell short.  The only thing that Chromecast is really good for is streaming YouTube and Netflix, and even then it's spotty.  About 30% of the time, playback will freeze and Chromecast will have to be removed from the TV completely to make it work again (this is true on both my smart phone and computer).  I have the fastest internet speed that my ISP provides, so I know that is not the problem.If you're thinking that you will be able to cast video from your computer screen onto your TV with Chromecast, don't hold your breath.  Yes, it does cast, but the video quality is awful and the picture lags behind the sound terribly, rendering this feature frustratingly useless.Besides YouTube and Netflix, I have yet to find any worthwhile supporting apps for Chromecast, which is ultimately Google's fault.  Honestly, I think that they should have worked on perfecting this a little longer before they rushed to release it for the 2013 holiday shopping season.  Hopefully in the near future, Google will improve the functionality of Chromecast so that it actually does all that it says it will.  When/if that happens, I'll be happy to change my review.
